title: [BEAM-7372][BEAM-9372] cleanup python 2.x and 3.5 codepaths
body:
Cleanup codepaths for python 2.x and 3.5 from codes, dataframes, examples and internal. Another few PR will be created for other packages because all of the changes are too large to review in a single PR. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11762] Upgrades Tensorflow, numpy, and grpcio dependencies
body:
We need to upgrade Beam 2.28.0 release branch to latest version of Tensorflow (2.4.1). Also upgrading numpy and grpcio to a matching version: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.4.1/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/setup.py#L84 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.4.1/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/setup.py#L121 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10961] Make mongo-java-driver dependency a named variable
body:
This PR implements a change suggested in PR# 13830. The mongo_java_driver created here will subsequently be used in that PR. R: @ibzib ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11715] [cherry-pick] Partial revert of "Combiner packing in Dataflow" (#13763)
body:
This reverts the use of `translations.pack_combiners` in DataflowRunner added in #13763, but preserves other changes (i.e. minor bug fix in `translations.pack_combiners`, disabling optimizations by default, and testing that `translations.pack_combiners` is disabled). This reason for the revert is that `translations.pack_combiners` results in packed CombinePerKey transforms without subtransforms which is not accepted by Dataflow, and that `Pipeline.from_runner_api` will break cross-language pipelines Cherry-pick of #13884. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11595] bump jackson to 2.12.1
body:
R: @lukecwik (I read [the PR](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/10643)) * add dependencies for nexmark-testing * We had to add `jackson_datatype_joda` to the dependency * add dependencies for license_scripts * Because the `sdks/java/container/license_scripts/license_script.sh` failed. Apparently it's because the `jackson-bom` license can't be obtained. I don't know the detailed cause ------ bump jackson to 2.12.1 - https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson/wiki/Jackson-Release-2.12 ### related * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11595 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11596 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11597 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11598 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11599 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11601 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11602 * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11603 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11326] Add a deadline of 30s to SplitReadStream
body:
This change sets a hard deadline of 30s on calls to SplitReadStream in the BigQuery storage source. This will help to avoid cases where pipelines are killed due to high-latency calls on this path. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11752] Using LoadingCache instead of Map to cache BundleProcessor
body:
Python SDK caches bundle_processors per process_bundle_descriptor and shutdowns inactive bundle_processors every 1 mins since last access: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/worker/sdk_worker.py#L557-L582. Currently Java only use Map to cache BundleProcessor, which is not really a cache with proper evicting policy. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11731][BEAM-10582] Allow pyarrow<4,numpy<1.21.0, improve pyarrow verification
body:
A few simultaneous changes here: - Allow pyarrow up to 3.x, numpy up to 1.21.x - Modifies CI to use numpy <1.20.0 when testing pyarrow <3 to workaround ARROW-11450 - Adds a new `uses_pyarrow` mark, so that we can test both `parquetio_test` and `dataframe.io_test` against multiple pyarrow versions Note this does _not_ protect our users from using numpy 1.20.0 and pyarrow <3. Unfortunately it doesn't look like there's a way to achieve that in setup.py. title: [BEAM-10925] Enable user-defined Java scalar functions in ZetaSQL.

title: [BEAM-11611] Add transformation for computing approximate quantiles.
body:
Adds a new transform to the stats package: Approximate Quantiles. This allows approximately computing quantiles for given comparable data. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11715] Partial revert of "Combiner packing in Dataflow" (#13763)
body:
This reverts the use of `translations.pack_combiners` in DataflowRunner added in #13763, but preserves other changes (i.e. minor bug fix in `translations.pack_combiners`, disabling optimizations by default, and testing that `translations.pack_combiners` is disabled). This reason for the revert is that `translations.pack_combiners` results in packed `CombinePerKey` transforms without subtransforms which is not accepted by Dataflow, and that `Pipeline.from_runner_api` will break cross-language pipelines ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11700] [cherry-pick] Fix PortableRunner skipping optimizations
body:
An indentation error in portable_runner.py is causing optimizations to not run when pre_optimize is set to default or all. This was broken by #13573. Additionally, the existing 'all' optimizations branch is not working in PortableRunner due to `greedily_fuse_stages` and `partial=False`. This change re-enables optimizations for 'default' and 'all'. It also disables `translations.pack_combiners` due to BEAM-11715, and adds an 'all_without_fusion' option that is used to run `PortableRunnerOptimizedWithoutFusion`. Cherry-pick of #13824. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11476] Resolve flaky tests
body:
Moved cleanup patch into each test method after each new_env() instance creation to avoid cleanup invocation in new_env() call when there could be race conditions in tests running on Jenkins. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Expanded MqttIO to return topic in addition to payload
body:
Users of MQTT sometimes subscribe to multiple topics but still need access to the individual topic of each message. With these changes, instead of byte arrays, the MqttIO reader returns "MqttMessage" objects that include a topic string and a timestamp instant in addition to the byte array payload. These changes likely break previous usages of the MqttIO. I am adding this pull request as a draft since I heavily depend on the added functionality but have not yet implemented proper tests. For a more in-depth description of the issue, please see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65780456/working-with-protobuf-encoded-mqtt-streams-in-apache-beam. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11715] Recreate subtransforms for packed combiners
body:
Currently `translations.pack_combiners` produces a `CombinePerKey` with no subtransforms, but some runners do not treat `CombinePerKey` as a primitive transform and require the `GroupByKey`, `Combine` and / or `ParDo(CombineValuesDoFn)` subtransforms to be present. This changes `translations.pack_combiners` to add the required subtransforms to the `CombinePerKey`. Additionally, this reverts some changes to DataflowRunner from #13763. It removes a workaround that used `PTransformOverride` to recreate the subtransforms. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9918] Support Tagged external PTransforms
body:
Support user side direction of cross language or external transforms. Often the runners have their own mechanism for interpretting a URN + Payload, but that payload may contain data to specify how to route the inputs and outputs. ExternalTagged permits users to provide local tags for the input PCollections and output PCollection types to assist with this routing. Later changes may want to add variadic Options to External and ExternalTagged to support Artifact provisioning, and Environment setting, though preferablly without using the beam protos directly in the API. (Similarly for ParDo as well). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Final merge of website revamp
body:
This PR is for the final merge of the website revamp into the master branch, which will publish it to https://beam.apache.org. This is the result of contributions generated by @bntnam and @Jakub-Sadowski, that were reviewed as [PRs into the website-revamp branch](https://github.com/apache/beam/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+base%3Awebsite-revamp). Note there are some minor issues (broken links) with the [staged version](http://apache-beam-website-pull-requests.storage.googleapis.com/13871/index.html) of this website generated by our infrastructure. title: [BEAM-11733] Skip flaky healthcare IO integration tests.
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10379] Remove BIT_XOR from ZetaSQL supported functions list.
body:
It does not pass internal compliance tests because nulls are not propagated correctly (this is not a flaw with BIT_XOR specifically, the problem seems to affect all ZetaSQL aggregations). title: [BEAM-11357] Copy Annotations when cloning PTransforms
body:
We need to copy Annotations field as well when doing a ShallowClonePTransform, otherwise we lose the Annotations. This is an issue when there multiple instances of the same DoFn with an annotation in the pipeline.

CREDITS=robertre@

title: [BEAM-11707] Change WindmillStateCache cache invalidation to be based…
body:
… upon reference invalidation instead of expensive set management. Reduce operations of shared cache by caching per-key object sets locally and flushing as groups to shared cache. Remove byte tracking which could be racy based upon background evictions in favor of just iterating for rendering the status page. Since we render only once every 10 minutes by default this seems fine. This also lets us capture more stats. This previously showed up as 6% cpu on benchmarks and dropped to 1.25% with this change with throughput increase as well. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11727] Optimize ExecutionStateSampler by removing unnecessary o…
body:
…rdering and concurrent data struture, when most accesses are already synchronized. Additionally reduce the scope synchronized block for the remove case to not include getting the current time. title: apache_beam.io.gcp.spanner: Documentation update
body:
Changed the documentation to reference the correct parameter for specifying the query to execute in `ReadFromSpanner` from `query` to `sql` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11772] Integrate BigQuery sink file loads with GroupIntoBatches
body:
Use GroupIntoBatches.WithShardedKey API to enable dynamic sharding when using FILE_LOADS for unbounded data. This is a follow-up change to #13496. This PR - Wires `withAutoSharding` option in BigQueryIO builder to `BatchLoads`. - Allows `numFileShards` to be 0 when performing streaming FILE_LOADS. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10029] Spanner IO read and write performance tests
body:
* Adds spannerio read and write performance tests. * Adds groovy jobs for spannerio performance tests. * `Run SpannerIO Write Performance Test Python Batch` * `Run SpannerIO Read Performance Test Python` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11324] Impose consistent ordering on partitionings used in PartitioningSession
body:
Without this change, it's possible that an incorrectly specified expression can create a flaky test. Since we only keep the result from the last executed partitioning, it's possible to get a false positive if, say, Singleton partitioning was used last. This change ensures we always use the most challenging partitioning for the final result. title: [BEAM-11715] Add ValidatesRunner test for translations.pack_combiners
body:
Add an integration test using TestPipeline with packable combiners. Combiner packing will be triggered if and only if the TestPipeline runner enables it. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Removed conscrypt from a shaded dataflow-worker jar
body:
Conscrypt shouldn't be shaded because i) conscrypt isn't aware of reallocated the native so file and ii) java security provider must be signed ([ref](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/security/crypto/HowToImplAProvider.html#Step6)). So Conscrypt should be used as is. R: @kennknowles @justinwhite @boyuanzz ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10925] Add optional jar path field to ZetaSqlScalarFunctionImpl.
body:
This is required to pass the jar path to BeamCalcRel (see #13835). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11628] Add initial support for GroupBy.apply
body:
This PR adds support for [GroupBy.apply](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/groupby.html#flexible-apply). In general this is a pretty simple operation, just a very customizable unliftable aggregation, but there's one major complication: the frames passed to the apply function include the _original_ index, while our groupby(..) implementation overrides any existing index with just the grouping indexes/columns so we can conveniently use Index() partitioning. There are a couple possible approaches to get the original index through, but neither is perfect: 1. Move the original indexes into columns, use set_index to move them back after grouping. 2. Don't remove the original indexes in groupby(..), instead just add any grouped columns, and keep all the original indexes. Then use Index(grouping_indexes + grouping_columns) partitioning. I spent some time trying to get (1) to work, but the book-keeping proved to be too painful. Handling grouped Series is tough, since they need to be turned into DataFrames and back, and projections on the DeferredGroupBy are tricky as well. This PR uses option (2), which was simpler to implement, but it would be the first application of `Index([i,j])` partitioning, which hasn't been well defined. In order to limit the effect the original to_group and ungrouped expressions are still used for operations that don't need the original index. title: [BEAM-11659] Add the ability to load a protobuf message SQL payload from an external descriptor set file.
body:
These can be generated using `protoc --descriptor_set_out= --include_imports`, and make protobuf serialization useful when in a pre-compiled binary (like dataflow SQL). Also make fixes to various SQL classes needed to make this happen, including: - Removing false generic nature of ProtoDynamicMessageSchema - Fixing cast behavior or RowMessages - Adding a static helper to Cast ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11709] Disable Gradle module metadata generation for Beam BOM
body:
Beam BOM incorrectly produces a Gradle module metadata with the variant library instead of platform. Temporarily disable the metadata generation so Gradle users can depend on Beam BOM as a platform Verified that the snapshot no longer produces a module file and manually created a project that was able to use the new snapshot of Beam BOM as a platform ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10925] Load user-provided jars in CalcFn.
body:
Note that it is possible for one CalcFn to require multiple jars, so for now it is the user's responsibility to ensure there are no conflicts. This is no different from user-provided jars in the Java SDK. This adds an optional jar path field to ScalarFunctionImpl. This field will be populated in a later PR. R: @amaliujia @apilloud ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-5214] Update java quickstart
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here @TheNeuralBit @rosetn @aaltay Made a few fixes and clarifications to the Java quickstart: * Changed the intro sentence to be closer to the Python quickstart and updated the phrasing for readability. * Added two sentences clarifying how to respond to prompts during the Maven-to-Gradle conversion. * Clarified a change required in **build.gradle**. * Added a sentence telling users to use the direct runner, if they're just trying out Beam and aren't sure what to use. * Made it clear that the procedure for running a pipeline is a generic procedure, and the actual commands for running WordCount are in the sections below. * Made a few other minor readability tweaks. * Resolves https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5214 * This work had already been done. I validated the fix. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11695] [cherry-pick] Combiner packing in Dataflow (#13763)
body:
Previously, combiner packing did not work in Dataflow because the optimizations were only applied to the `proto_pipeline` object and not the `pipeline` object. This fixes combiner packing, and also makes it disabled by default unless enabled using the `pre_optimize` option. Cherry-pick of #13763. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11700] Fix PortableRunner skipping optimizations
body:
An indentation error in portable_runner.py is causing optimizations to not run when pre_optimize is set to default or all. This was broken by #13573. Additionally, the existing 'all' optimizations branch is not working in PortableRunner due to `greedily_fuse_stages` and `partial=False`. This change re-enables optimizations for 'default' and 'all'. It also disables `translations.pack_combiners` due to BEAM-11715, and adds an 'all_without_fusion' option that is used to run `PortableRunnerOptimizedWithoutFusion`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11658] Match .snappy files into the given (de)compressor
body:
Snappy is a compression/decompression library. It does not aim for maximum compression or compatibility with any other compression library; instead, it aims for very high speeds and reasonable compression. For instance, compared to the fastest mode of zlib, Snappy is an order of magnitude faster for most inputs, but the resulting compressed files are anywhere from 20% to 100% bigger. Even if there is support for Snappy in Beam's dependencies, there was no way of matching .snappy files to the given (de)compressor. This PR provides that. R: @iemejia ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11695] Remove translations.pack_combiners from default optimizers for FnApiRunner and PortableRunner
body:
Due to issues with translations.pack_combiners, it is temporarily removed from default optimizers. A new unit test checks that the optimizer does not run. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11693]  Update formatting. Fix email template
body:
Adjust the formatting of the markdown in the release guide to be 1 sentence per line, rather than mix of that, 1 paragraph per line, and 80 char formatted. This makes reviewing later changes simpler, as new sentences appear as new lines, changes and removals as one would expect. Also fixes the email template, which was broken by the explict more summary tag. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
